sentence.Network_en: The shark was writhing around wildly, trying to get free.
sentence.Network_cn: 鲨鱼拼命挣扎，试图逃脱。

sentence.Network_en: George struggled wildly, going under and resurfacing at regular intervals.
sentence.Network_cn: 乔治疯狂地挣扎，不断在水面上浮浮沉沉。

sentence.Network_en: The truck sways wildly, careening down narrow mountain roads.
sentence.Network_cn: 卡车疯狂地左摇右晃，从狭窄的山路上急冲而下。

entry.def: You use wildly to emphasize the degree, amount, or intensity of something.

example.ex: Reports of his drinking have been wildly exaggerated...
example.tran: 有关他酗酒的报道极尽夸张。

means.word_mean: 1. to an extreme or greatly exaggerated degree;
2. in an uncontrolled or unrestrained manner;

sentences.sentence: "attacked wildly, slashing and stabbing over and over"

auth_sentence.content: I danced wildly, sexily, skillfully, angrily.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I danced wildly, sexily, skillfully, angrily.

auth_sentence.content: Tom -- or John mentioned me being wildly liberal.
auth_sentence.res_content: Tom -- or John mentioned me being wildly liberal.

auth_sentence.content: My stories have varied wildly in type and scope.
auth_sentence.res_content: My stories have varied wildly in type and scope.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My stories have varied wildly in type and scope.

sentences.en: When he tried to ride the horse, it bucked wildly.
sentences.cn: 当他试图骑上这匹马时,它突然狂暴地跃了起来。
